titleStmt.title: Sad and serious politicall considerations touching the invasive war against our Presbyterian Protestant brethren in Scotland, their late great overthrow, and the probable dangerous consequences thereof to both nations and the Prorestant [sic] religion which may serve as a satisfactory apology for such ministers and people, who out of conscience did not observe the publike thanksgiving against their covenant, for the great slaughter of those their brethren in covenant.
titleStmt.author: Prynne, William, 1600-1669.

notesStmt.note: Protesting Cromwell's invasion of Scotland and the celebration of his victory at Dunbar.
Attributed to William Prynne. Cf. NUC pre-1956.
Place of publication from NUC pre-1956 imprints.
Reproduction of original in Yale University Library.
With: A brief description of the future history of Europe, from anno 1650 to an. 1710. London : [s.n.], 1650.
